title: Ireland stick with tried-and-trusted team for World Cup quarter-final clash against New Zealand
text:
Ireland have gone with tried-and-trusted combinations all over the field for their World Cup quarter-final clash against New Zealand on Saturday, Joe Schmidt resisting the urge to spring any Henry Slade-style last-minute surprises.

Where England shocked everyone on Thursday morning by naming the Exeter centre in their lineup to face Australia, Schmidt has gone back to his most experienced players.

Hooker Rory Best leads the team, with Cian Healy and Tadhg Furlong either side of him. In the second row, Iain Henderson and James Ryan are paired together, while Peter O’Mahony, Josh van der Flier and CJ Stander form the back row.

In the backs, Bundee Aki’s suspension means Schmidt has had to make...
description: Ireland have gone with tried-and-trusted combinations all over the field for their World Cup quarter-final clash against New Zealand on Saturday, Joe Schmidt resisting the urge to spring any Henry Slade-style last-minute surprises.
